sourceMeaningMnemonic: You have <radical>fins</radical> in <radical>private</radical>. But, you want the world to see them, so you take them <kanji>public</kanji>.
meaningInfo: Picture yourself in private, with fins. You wish others could see them. "That's it," you decide. "It's time to show the world. I'm going to make my fins public!"
readingMnemonic: You head out into the <kanji>public</kanji> where everyone can see your fins, but... things have changed. All people are the same. There are thousands of <ja><reading>こう</reading>いち</ja>s walking around, and they all stare at you (though they pretend like they aren't).
readingInfo:
Remember, whenever we see the reading <ja>こう</ja>, think of <ja>こういち</ja>, a founder of WaniKani. We'll keep it consistent, so over time you should develop a character around <ja>こういち</ja> that you learn to love or hate.

How long have you been hiding in private with your fins? The public areas have changed, and all the people have become <ja>こういち</ja>s. One mother <ja>こういち</ja>--pushing a baby <ja>こういち</ja>--looks up and stares at your fins. Now you remember why you never go out in public.
